revised_title: The Nervous System and Its Functions: A Review of Inferences and Observations
tldr: The author discusses the functions of the nervous system and its two main classes of nerves. They argue that the sensorial, nervous, and muscular powers are all interconnected and essential for vital functions, and that the nervous system supports processes of secretion and assimilation. The author also explains the dependence of respiration on these three powers and the voluntary nature of respiratory muscles.
